TopicTitle: KerbPro Track Day Ã¢â‚¬â€œ A Kerbal Racing Challenge

Articles.Content:
![KSP%202015-03-23%2010-46-03-876.png?_subject_uid=296046575&w=AADcpQIRD_K4wOPrdpa2Y1-tpA7P5mhoojS5PA4ou54BwQ](https://dl-web.dropbox.com/get/Images/KSP%202015-03-23%2010-46-03-876.png?_subject_uid=296046575&w=AADcpQIRD_K4wOPrdpa2Y1-tpA7P5mhoojS5PA4ou54BwQ)

So, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve seen stuff like the [Dukes of Duna 4K Speedrun Challenge](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112890-Dukes-of-Duna-4K-rover-speedrun-challenge%21), but I havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t really seen any challenge which factors in actual rover driving skill (turning, braking, etc.). So, I decided to make my own. Hoping my laziness didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t overlook an already-existing KSC rover building/driving challenge (I managed to look back about 5 pages before giving up), I present to you KerbPro Track Day!

I'm looking for some of the best Kerbal rover designers to build and race their rovers around the KSC in the shortest time possible.

**Objective**

Build a rover and drive one lap around the KSC in the shortest time possible.

**The Track**

![n8xaoYU.png](http://i.imgur.com/n8xaoYU.png)

The track is marked in the above picture. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be driving around most of the perimeter of the KSC, only excluding the Administration Centre. You have no save to download which features checkpoints of any sort Ã¢â‚¬â€œ just follow the road.

**The Rovers**

The rovers are split into four classes: **Tiny**, **Light**, **Medium**, and **Heavy**.

The **Tiny** class must be no bigger than 1.5/1.5/1.5m (L/W/H) and be no heavier than 3t.

The **Light** class must be no bigger than 3.0/3.0/3.0m and be no heavier than 5t.

The **Medium** class must be no bigger than 5.0/5.0/3.0m and be no heavier than 10t.

The **Heavy** class must be no bigger than 10/10/6.0m and be no heavier than 20t (I want you guys to get creative ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)).

Any larger and I might have to make a HUGE rover class. I can only imagine how one can drive it around the KSC with a good lap timeÃ¢â‚¬Â¦

Since there are three classes, of course, there will be three separate leaderboards so as to keep things fair. The leaderboards are listed at the bottom of the page.

**Building Requirements**

1) Despite what the title says, KerbPro (rather, the [Hullcam VDS mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365-0-90-Hullcam-VDS-0-90-update-Updated-16-Dec)) **isnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t necessary** to enter the challenge. I just thought itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d be cool to throw in the name as a sponsor brand or something.

2) Manned/unmanned rovers donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t really make a difference as far as KSP physics is concerned. Just get them within the size limits.

3) The rover must still work **after** the run. It has to still be driveable, even if whatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s left of it is half of its body and 2 wheels.

4) The rover **must** have wheels.

5) Boost is allowed, of course, but the rover must still be able to run without boost power.

 > **Addendum**: Whatever propulsion method you use (F/O, MonoProp, Ion) doesn't matter.

6) Mod parts **can** be used for your rover (list of confirmed Ã¢â‚¬Å“safeÃ¢â‚¬Â mods below). IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d really like to see variety in the competition, like rovers using Kerbal Foundries wheels, etc.

7) FAR/NEAR is allowed; just donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t forget to mention it when you submit your time.

> 
> > [TweakScale](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/112693) (canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t think of any way to cheat the fuel or the wheels with this mod, so itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s safe)
> 
> > [Hullcam VDS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/46365-0-90-Hullcam-VDS-0-90-update-Updated-16-Dec) (I use this personally for recording purposes. Also not a cheat mod from my set rules.)
> 
> > [Snacks!](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/90841-0-90-Snacks!-Kerbal-simplified-life-support-v0-3-3) And [WhyrenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Snack Parts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92025-Snacks-Life-Support-Parts-by-Whyren-v1) (these mods donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t affect anything, but I just thought IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d get that out of the way)
> 
> > B9 Aerospace, Kerbal Foundries, and other parts pack mods
> 
> > Stock Parts Revamp
> 
> > Pretty much anything that doesn't mess with fuel or crash tolerance configs
> 
> 

**Building Limitations**

1) Mods like MechJeb, HyperEdit, and Debug Toolbar are **not allowed**.

2) Modifying part configs are also **not allowed**.

3) Part altering mods are also **not allowed**.

**Keeping Score**

Keeping score of the rovers will use the basic mission timer at the top-left of your game screen. Keep track of the time you start driving, and when you come back to/pass the same spot. Subtract the time between the two, and you have your lap time. It is recommended to plant a flag beforehand as a start/finish line. You do **not** have to stop at the finish line; as long as you can keep the time you passed there, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re good to go.

An easier way to keep score is to attach a launch clamp to your rover. The mission clock **wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t** move until you decouple from the clamp and start moving. The clamp pillar will also serve as a start/finish line for convenience.

**Submitting Your Score**

Include at least **three pictures**:

> 1 at the starting line

> 1 somewhere in between

> 1 as you pass the finish line

Also include a short description of your rover, its features, et cetera.

Do share extra pictures of your rover, or maybe even a craft file of the rover, although itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s obviously not required. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d also love to see a YouTube video of your run, if you recorded one!

**Miscellaneous Awards**

> **Style Award**: ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s no winning better than winning and looking good while youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re at it.

> **Wacky Award**: Kerbal designs have always been known to be crazy. So go crazy! Go Kerbal!

> **Purist Award**: You completed your run with an all-stock rover.

> **Boostless Award**: You completed your run with no boost system. 

> **Survivor Award**: You finished the race by the skin of your teethÃ¢â‚¬Â¦and a driveable fraction of your rover.

> **Blowout Award**: Blowout your wheels at some point during the race. If you actually make it past the finish line, thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a bonus Survivor award for you as well!

(IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll probably add some more awards here, but canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t think of any beyond this right now. Let me know if you have a cool award idea!)

If you have any questions, please let me know via PM or on this thread. 

Now, may the best man win!

**My Run**
